description: Dormer window in rear roof slope of house (Brentham Garden Estate Conservation Area)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | Notwithstanding any information given in the submitted drawings the sides and face of the dormer shall be finished in lead sheet.  REASON:   To protect the character of the Brentham Garden Estate Conservation Area, in accordance with UDP Policies B1, B24, H8, and deposit UDP Policies 4.8. | Detailed drawings and cross sections at a scale of 1:1 in respect of the proposed timbre work including the cornice, window surround and window frames (including sills, transoms, mullions and glazing bars), shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority in writing prior to commencement of the development. Such details shall be implemented only in accordance with drawings as approved.  REASON:   To safeguard the character and appearance of the Brentham Garden Estate in accordance with Unitary Development Plan Policies H8, B1 and B24 and deposit draft Unitary Development Plan Policy 4.8. | The exterior finish of the proposed new window shall match that of the other windows on the building.  REASON:   To safeguard the character and appearance of the Brentham Garden Estate in accordance with Unitary Development Plan Policies H8, B1 and B24 and deposit draft Unitary Development Plan Policy 4.8.
